TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TypeIdSetDefinition extends Microsoft.Health.AuthorizationSetDefinition

Docs.summary: Defines a set of health record items of the specified type for authorization purposes.
Docs.remarks: Permissions on data in a person's health records are always included in an authorization set (whether implicitly via their type or effective date, or explicitly by setting the system set.) This class serves as a set of health record items that have a specified type ID. Other types of authorization sets include: .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Guid typeId) cil managed

Docs.param: The identifier of the type for the set.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with the specified type identifier.
Docs.remarks:
The must be the identifier for a health record item type. See

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetXml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the XML representation of the set.
Docs.returns: The XML representation of the set as a string.
Docs.remarks: The XML representation adheres to the schema required by the HealthVault methods.

Docs.summary: Gets the type identifier for the set.
Docs.value: A Guid representing the unique identifier for a health record item type.
Docs.remarks:
The value must be the identifier for a health record item type.
for information on getting the value health record item types.
